| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | [monst.c#line2632](/wiki/Monst.c#line2632 "Monst.c")                                       |

An **electric eel**, ;, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is an [oviparous](/wiki/Oviparous "Oviparous") [sea monster](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") like its cousin, the [giant eel](/wiki/Giant_eel "Giant eel"). Electric eels have a touch attack that can result in a potential [drowning](/wiki/Drowning "Drowning") [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath") if [you](/wiki/You "You") are near any [pool](/wiki/Pool "Pool") of water, as well as a [shocking](/wiki/Shock "Shock") bite attack that can destroy [wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand") and [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring").

Eating an electric eel [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") has a 47% chance of conveying [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance").

## Generation

Electric eels are not randomly generated, but are a common sight in [swamp](/wiki/Swamp "Swamp") rooms.

Six electric eels are generated at level creation on the second variant of [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island"), and eight are generated at level creation on the [Plane of Water](/wiki/Plane_of_Water "Plane of Water").

## Strategy

Electric eels are especially concerning when crossing large bodies of water: in addition to drowning you normally like giant eels and [kraken](/wiki/Kraken "Kraken"), their shocking bite can destroy a [ring of levitation](/wiki/Ring_of_levitation "Ring of levitation"), which can instantly drown you if it happens over water. As with other sea monsters, dispatch electric eels at a range outside of their reach to minimize danger, and use any monster-locating method (e.g., [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") or [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")) to make sure none of them get the jump on you.

The usual safeguards against drowning attacks apply, e.g., a non-[cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") [oilskin cloak](/wiki/Oilskin_cloak "Oilskin cloak") prevents grabbing, and a [wand of teleportation](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation") can reliably warp them away even on [non-teleport levels](/wiki/Non-teleport_level "Non-teleport level"). You can also use any means of scaring monsters such as [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), or initiate [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") via other sources like a [potion](/wiki/Potion_of_levitation "Potion of levitation") or [spell](/wiki/Spell_of_levitation "Spell of levitation"), to shake loose an eel that has wrapped around you. Electric eels are vulnerable to spells and wands since they lack an [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), but their -3 [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") makes this unreliable for dealing with one that is about to drown you.

Electric eels are most dangerous in the Plane of Water: you are all but forced into proximity to them and cannot [engrave](/wiki/Engrave "Engrave") anything. Most methods of keeping them back are still viable, such as wands of teleportation and instruments like [tooled horns](/wiki/Tooled_horn "Tooled horn"), but the [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold") and [cone of cold](/wiki/Cone_of_cold "Cone of cold") spell are rendered unusable, as is the [scroll of earth](/wiki/Scroll_of_earth "Scroll of earth"). Many players prefer to not take chances and instead use a blessed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") to wipe out all [;](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") right after entering the level.

Electric eel corpses are generally passed over as a source of shock resistance, since they must usually be retrieved from the water they were killed in. This is easiest to do in [swamp](/wiki/Swamp "Swamp") rooms: you can use a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") or other fire source to evaporate the pool and its surrounding waters into [pits](/wiki/Pit "Pit"), or freeze the square and adjacent waters before [digging](/wiki/Digging "Digging") out the corpse.

## Encyclopedia entry

South-American fish (\_Gymnotus electricus\_), living in fresh water. Shaped like a serpent, it can grow up to 2 metres. This eel is known for its electrical organ which enables it to paralyse creatures up to the size of a horse.  
\[ Van Dale's Groot Woordenboek der Nederlandse Taal ]

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Electric eel

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
; electric eel
Difficulty 10
Attacks Bite shock 4d6, drowning
; electric eel
Difficulty 10
Attacks

Bite shock 4d6, drowning

Base level 7
Base experience 1129
Speed 10
Base AC −3
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 200
Nutritional value 250
Size Huge
Resistances Shock
Resistances conveyed Shock (47%)

An electric eel:

  • can swim.
  • can survive underwater.
  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no limbs.
  • is an animal.
  • has a serpent body.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line2632

An electric eel, ;, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is an oviparous sea monster like its cousin, the giant eel. Electric eels have a touch attack that can result in a potential drowning instadeath if you are near any pool of water, as well as a shocking bite attack that can destroy wands and rings.

Eating an electric eel corpse has a 47% chance of conveying shock resistance.

Generation

Electric eels are not randomly generated, but are a common sight in swamp rooms.

Six electric eels are generated at level creation on the second variant of Medusa's Island, and eight are generated at level creation on the Plane of Water.

Strategy

Electric eels are especially concerning when crossing large bodies of water: in addition to drowning you normally like giant eels and kraken, their shocking bite can destroy a ring of levitation, which can instantly drown you if it happens over water. As with other sea monsters, dispatch electric eels at a range outside of their reach to minimize danger, and use any monster-locating method (e.g., telepathy or warning) to make sure none of them get the jump on you.

The usual safeguards against drowning attacks apply, e.g., a non-cursed oilskin cloak prevents grabbing, and a wand of teleportation can reliably warp them away even on non-teleport levels. You can also use any means of scaring monsters such as Elbereth, or initiate levitation via other sources like a potion or spell, to shake loose an eel that has wrapped around you. Electric eels are vulnerable to spells and wands since they lack an MR score, but their -3 AC makes this unreliable for dealing with one that is about to drown you.

Electric eels are most dangerous in the Plane of Water: you are all but forced into proximity to them and cannot engrave anything. Most methods of keeping them back are still viable, such as wands of teleportation and instruments like tooled horns, but the wand of cold and cone of cold spell are rendered unusable, as is the scroll of earth. Many players prefer to not take chances and instead use a blessed scroll of genocide to wipe out all ; right after entering the level.

Electric eel corpses are generally passed over as a source of shock resistance, since they must usually be retrieved from the water they were killed in. This is easiest to do in swamp rooms: you can use a wand of fire or other fire source to evaporate the pool and its surrounding waters into pits, or freeze the square and adjacent waters before digging out the corpse.

Encyclopedia entry

South-American fish (_Gymnotus electricus_), living in fresh water. Shaped like a serpent, it can grow up to 2 metres. This eel is known for its electrical organ which enables it to paralyse creatures up to the size of a horse.
[ Van Dale's Groot Woordenboek der Nederlandse Taal ]

An '''electric eel''', {{monsym|electric eel}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is an [[oviparous]] [[sea monster]] like its cousin, the [[giant eel]]. Electric eels have a touch attack that can result in a potential [[drowning]] [[instadeath]] if [[you]] are near any [[pool]] of water, as well as a [[shock]]ing bite attack that can destroy [[wand]]s and [[ring]]s.

Eating an electric eel [[corpse]] has a 47% chance of conveying [[shock resistance]]. 

==Generation==
Electric eels are not randomly generated, but are a common sight in [[swamp]] rooms.

Six electric eels are generated at level creation on the second variant of [[Medusa's Island]], and eight are generated at level creation on the [[Plane of Water]].

==Strategy==
Electric eels are especially concerning when crossing large bodies of water: in addition to drowning you normally like giant eels and [[kraken]], their shocking bite can destroy a [[ring of levitation]], which can instantly drown you if it happens over water. As with other sea monsters, dispatch electric eels at a range outside of their reach to minimize danger, and use any monster-locating method (e.g., [[telepathy]] or [[warning]]) to make sure none of them get the jump on you. 

The usual safeguards against drowning attacks apply, e.g., a non-[[cursed]] [[oilskin cloak]] prevents grabbing, and a [[wand of teleportation]] can reliably warp them away even on [[non-teleport level]]s. You can also use any means of scaring monsters such as [[Elbereth]], or initiate [[levitation]] via other sources like a [[potion of levitation|potion]] or [[spell of levitation|spell]], to shake loose an eel that has wrapped around you. Electric eels are vulnerable to spells and wands since they lack an [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]], but their -3 [[AC]] makes this unreliable for dealing with one that is about to drown you.

Electric eels are most dangerous in the Plane of Water: you are all but forced into proximity to them and cannot [[engrave]] anything. Most methods of keeping them back are still viable, such as wands of teleportation and instruments like [[tooled horn]]s, but the [[wand of cold]] and [[cone of cold]] spell are rendered unusable, as is the [[scroll of earth]]. Many players prefer to not take chances and instead use a blessed [[scroll of genocide]] to wipe out all {{mcsl|;}} right after entering the level.

Electric eel corpses are generally passed over as a source of shock resistance, since they must usually be retrieved from the water they were killed in. This is easiest to do in [[swamp]] rooms: you can use a [[wand of fire]] or other fire source to evaporate the pool and its surrounding waters into [[pit]]s, or freeze the square and adjacent waters before [[digging]] out the corpse.
